page.title: 09 FARMING
page.content: The area lies between the mountains and the sea on the costal plain, between Newport and Cardiff.The farms are all over a hundred years old but have been brought up to date with electricity,gas,piped water,etc...They are all between 50 and 100 acres in size.They all rear animals as the land is too salty to grow crops.The main animals kept were goats,horses,pigs and cows kept for meat and skins as little milk is sold to the dairy.The farms are family run and provide little employment for local people. They grow few crops for their own use. The sea washed turf is popular for lawns and much is cut in the area.
